sub_title: Business Analyst at NN Investment Partners

My predominant focus is to provide solutions and services at the convergence of technology, engineering and system innovations. I specialize in stakeholder analysis, data analysis, impact analysis of emerging technologies and system modeling.

projects.title: Corporate Venturing as an Instrument for Radical Innovation: A Case on Google Ventures (GV)
projects.description: An integration of the mainstream organization with their corporate venturing units can create technological breakthroughs that lead to wealth creation, internally generated opportunities for corporate reinvention, business growth and new business development(Burgelman 1984). The study is empirical in nature looking at the strategic intent of Google Inc into its venture arm Google Ventures.We discuss about the portfolio in detail and also speak about GV’s strategic partnerships and its financial performance.Furthermore, the paper sheds more light on the literature which gives an overview of how corporate venturing happens and what challenges are present to handle a corporate venturing program that promotes innovation.

contributors.headline: Business Analyst at NN Investment Partners
Risk manager at Rabobank

projects.title: PV Diesel Hybrid Understanding the Innovation System
projects.description: The study tried to evaluate if PV Diesel Hybrid Mini-grid innovations are really a solution to electrify the rural parts of sub-Saharan Africa. The research was conducted by drawing insights in to 4 different perspectives of system innovation namely  transition perspective, risk and uncertainties, asset management perspective and regulatory/collaboration efforts . The study tried to identify the bottlenecks that have not led this innovation transition to higher phases from its development phase. It has evaluated if the institutional policies and collaboration yield better results in electrifying Africa. Each perspective has contributed towards detailed understanding of the various aspects of this innovation system.

contributors.headline: Business Analyst at NN Investment Partners

projects.title: Responsible Innovation in Electronic Waste Recycling
projects.description: Electronic equipment with its functionality and use has become increasingly popular among consumers across the world. With growing inventions in electronic equipment the pattern of sales, adoption, storage and end-of-life management (disposal and recycling) also changes. Recycling of this e-waste can be a valuable source for secondary materials if handled properly. If not, they can be a source for hazardous substances like toxins and carcinogens increasing danger to communities involved in recycling. The project deals with the analyzing the e-waste recycling from a “Responsible Innovation(RI)” perspective. The RI framework of Constructive Technology Assessment(CTA) was applied. The CTA framework is supported by foresight of future impacts, technology assessment, scenario development and more importantly stakeholder involvement starting from the design phase of innovation process which play an important role to understand the recycling innovations.

contributors.headline: Business Analyst at NN Investment Partners
R&D teamlead Electrical & Embedded Software development bij TK Elevator

projects.title: Socio-Technical Perspective of BIG Data
projects.description: BIG Data is a socio-technical phenomenon which also carries its weight of being a boon as well as bane to the society. It is a powerful tool which enables data insights through in diversified domains of healthcare, public sector, manufacturing, retail catering to societal needs. It also is seen to be the BIG Brother trying to breach privacy, violating intellectual rights along with the questions on the reliability of such data insights (Boyd & Crawford, 2012).The research was conducted to understand the socio-technical perspective of BIG Data and what factors led to its emergence in the last decade.The research also tried to understand what are the contributions/implications of BIG Data on the present and future societies and which other complementary technologies are in relation with this.

contributors.headline: Business Analyst at NN Investment Partners

projects.title: Technology Patterns and Standard’s Battles of Mobile Operating Systems Case of Android Vs. iOS
projects.description: The study focused on technological evolution of mobile operating system, the pattern of evolution, the factors and stakeholders who played a key role in standards battle of iOS and Android mobile operating systems. The main objective of the research was to understand the dynamics of the technology evolution and how the technology battle of standards was fought. The theoretical background of standards battles, technology patterns for the mobile operating system and the relations between these were carefully studied. The study specially discusses the case of Android and iOS operating systems and performs an empirical analysis.

projects.title: Functions of Innovation Systems: An altered approach to 'social innovation' to ecological sanitation in India
projects.description: To analyze the innovation concepts of “Ecological sanitation(Ecosan)” as a strategic niche for the rural sector in India. Ecosan toilets was analysed as  a social innovation, by applying the framework of “ Functions of Innovation systems” to understand and improve the innovation environment and system in India. The various indicators used in the framework led us to understand the policies,the drivers and the challenges of such an innovation in a developing country like India.

projects.title: Analysis of the decision making process for the construction of link road in Mumbai, India
projects.description: Metropolitan Indian cities like Mumbai are undergoing the urban transformation with infrastructure development. Paradoxically these developments embed the origins of poverty which otherwise are channeled to reduce it. This paper unveils how the decision making process in India for construction of a road in Mumbai evolved. It focuses on why this project missed 11 deadlines and what factors influenced the delay in the decisions made. The study is conducted by applying the theoretical frameworks of decision making at the same time reflecting on the socio-political aspects in India.

contributors.headline: Business Analyst at NN Investment Partners

projects.title: Gender Imbalance in India-System Dynamics Modelling
projects.description: This paper explores the gender imbalance in India caused by sex selective abortions and its social consequence up to the year 2040. It reflects primarily on the practices of sex-selective abortions through access to pre-natal sex determination, cultural preference for sons, and dowry system practiced in India. A System Dynamics model is used to simulate the extent of gender imbalance across the population structure (grouped in 2-gender cohorts) and its consequences for the marriage market. Model behavior for the base case scenario is explored and compared to the results under two potential policies for overcoming the gender gap: a strict ban of pre-natal sex determination and allowances for families with daughters.

projects.title: Impact of Technology on Shopping and Insomnia-Statistical Modelling study
projects.description:
Technology impacts our lives in many different ways. Our daily routines such as work, studying, exercising, eating, etc. rely extensively on different sort of technologies. For example digital devices in modern society have become an essential element of our activities- consider ICT (Information and Communication Technologies), astonishing numbers according to (ITU Telecommunication Development Sector, 2013) reveals that nowadays there are for each 100 inhabitants in the world 96,2 mobile-cellular subscriptions, 40,7 households with a computer and 29,5 active mobile-broadband, which shows the magnitude of the impact worldwide.
As part the course of Statistical Modeling for the Masters of Engineering and Policy Analysis at the Technology University of Delft given by Petra Heijnen, a group research with applied statistics on the Impact of Technology in Life was conducted. In our case, two specific topics have been developed which are the impact of technological devices (digital ones) in Insomnia as well as what factors of technology influence the frequency of online shopping. The framework of this work consists of applied statistics mainly with the usage of Descriptive Statistics, correlation analysis of variables and linear regression model construction. The literature referred to apply the used techniques is a reader of Statistical Modeling by (Heijnen, 2013/2014).

projects.title: Analysis of Dominos Business in China from cross cultural perspective
projects.description: Cultural differences play a significant role in the international expansion of businesses especially when we speak about food based businesses where cultures have a huge impact on the buying behaviors of the consumers. The aim of this study is to analyze the failure of the expansion of US-based fast food chain Domino’s Pizza in the Chinese markets from cross cultural perspectives. The theoretical framework of the study comprises the use of the cultural dimensions defined by Hofstede and Trompenaar, the marketing strategies, and the business model adopted by Domino’s Pizza in China. The study compares the cultures and marketing strategies between USA and China and clearly draws hypotheses of the main failure of Domino’s in China. The conclusion drawn from the study is that, there is surely an influence of the cultural differences of both cultures on the failure of Domino’s in China.

projects.title: Principles of Policy Analysis: "The Fyra case: Problems with the new high speed trains"
projects.description: In 2013, the management and Board of Commissioners of the Dutch Railways (NS) decided to stop operating the V250 high speed train built by the Italian train builder AnsaldoBreda. However, the Dutch Ministry of Infrastructures and the Environment had already invested about €7b in the whole project. The aim of the paper was to apply the principles of policy analysis to this complex situation, which gathered a large number of stakeholders with very diverse interests. Therefore, potential alternatives were analyzed and compared to get out of the deadlock.

profile_positions.title: Business Analyst- Post Integration Phase

profile_positions.description:
Post legal integration of ABN AMRO Bank and FORTIS Bank Netherlands, ABN AMRO Bank has decided to maintain a common integrated Sophis platform which can support both PIP-Private Investor Products and SPAIS- Structured Products Administration in Sophis business activities.

The Integration program is executed in two phases. In Phase 1a we were more focussed on consolidating the x-ABN & x-Fortis trading activities on to a single trading platform Sophis, while retaining the IT infrastructure & business processes as-is. 
Phase 1b was more focused on the data migration of x-Fortis Positions onto the migrated platform of x-ABN 

Played the role of a test lead in Back Office  testing for the E2E delivery of the project.Highlights of  contributions to the project

• Primary SPOC for understanding and analyzing of the Back Office requirements for test preparation  for the test team.
• Involved in validation of the workflow definitions,payments,confirmations and reconciliation extracts.
• Engaged in functional,supporting user acceptance testing and dress rehearsal cycles.
• E2E downstream testing alignment with Intellimatch,Collateral management,Clearing and Custody applications.
• Data migration activities with validation from the source and the target data along with reconciliations and SQL queries.
• Bug reporting and also assisted the development and business analysts for providing solutions for faster fixes.
